top.title: Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law
top.snippet:
The four UK Assay Offices have issued a joint open letter to MPs urging action in reforming the Hallmarking Act 1973. This open letter is fully supported by the National Association of Jewellers (NAJ). Hallmarking remains a cornerstone of consumer protection, providing independent assurance of precious metal quality and safeguarding public trust in jewellery and […]
The post Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: The UK Assay Offices and the National Association of Jewellers are calling for reform of the Hallmarking Act 1973 in order to safeguard public trust in the jewellery industry through independent assurance of precious metal quality.

In her new role, Hirst will work closely with store managers […]

top.aiSummary: In December 2025, Hannah Hirst was appointed as the new retail director at Hugh Rice the Jewellers, bringing extensive experience and strong brand partnerships to the role. Hirst will collaborate closely with store managers in her new position.

top.title: Wongs Jewellers debuts new Manchester store today
top.snippet:
Manchester’s Arndale Centre welcomes Wongs Jewellers today, marking its first expansion outside Liverpool. Now, after 45 years in the making, Wongs Jewellers is opening a store that celebrates the family legacy while […]
